meanings.definition: The quality or state of being briny.
meanings.sent1: The brininesses of the ocean water made it taste salty.
meanings.sent2: I could taste the brininesses of the sea in the air near the beach.
meanings.sent3: The chef exaggerated the brininesses of the soup by adding extra salt.
meanings.sent4: The brininesses of the tears shed during the sad movie were palpable.
meanings.sent5: The brininesses of the pickle juice lingered on my tongue.

meanings.definition: The taste or flavor of salt water.
meanings.sent1: After swimming in the ocean, I could still taste the brininesses on my lips.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were accustomed to the brininesses of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected brininesses of the lemonade caught me by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The brininesses of the sea breeze added a unique flavor to the evening.
meanings.sent5: The soup had an overwhelming brininesses that reminded me of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The presence of salt in a substance.
meanings.sent1: The brininesses in the air near the salt flats was unmistakable.
meanings.sent2: The chef could detect the subtle brininesses in the dish.
meanings.sent3: The brininesses of the chips made them irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The brininesses of the soil near the coast affected the crops' growth.
meanings.sent5: The brininesses of the air near the sea made everything feel fresh.
